title: How to gift a book to another Kindle user - Quora

response.answer_text: If you mean one you've already purchased, you can "loan" it to them for 2 weeks if it's eligible for loaning (you can go to "Manage your kindle" and click on the title you want to loan. If it's eligible, you can click on the "Loan this book" link) or you can just click on the "Gift as a gift" link if you're purchasing a new Kindle book. Unfortunately, you can't "give" away Kindle books you've purchased for yourself once you're done reading them like you can with a physical book.

Go to the Amazon Kindle store and search for the book you want to buy.On the right-hand side of the page, underneath the “Buy Now” button, click on the button that says “Give as a Gift”.Now you can select how you want the book delivered. You can either have the gift email sent right to the recipient or to you.For me I found it as buy for others button, or you may find give as gift.

If you go to your books page there is an option that says "give as gift" near the buy button. You will have to pay for it then you give the recipients email address and an email is sent to him or her with a download link.

Yes, you can lend Kindle ebooks to others, but notice that each book can be lent only ONCE for a 14-day period, http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_left_sib?ie=UTF8&nodeId=200549320.  You can also purchase Kindle ebooks and gift them, http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_200127470_ksupport_gifting&nodeId=200555070  Hope it helps!
